description.hltext_display: Centre technique des industries mécaniques et électriques en Tunisie
description.content:
Afrique du Nord - Tunisie
Tunisie - Le Cetime (Centre technique des industries mécaniques et électriques) n'a cessé de renforcer son assise technologique à travers notamment le renforcement de son réseau de partenariats à l'échelle internationale et la consolidation de son savoir-faire.
Ainsi, et en complément à son expertise développée grâce à un partenariat «gagnant/gagnant» établi avec son homologue français « Cetim », CemaFroid (France) , AT4 Wireless (Espagne), ISQ (Portugal), ISI (France), SWECO (Suède),... et ses retombées sur le niveau d'appropriation des nouvelles technologies par les entreprises tunisiennes, à travers les actions d'assistance et d'accompagnement menées conjointement pour assurer le transfert de technologies et de savoir-faire dans différents domaines, notamment dans les domaines du soudage et ses techniques connexes, de la maintenance préventive et du froid industriel, le Cetime a procédé, le mardi 7 décembre 2010, à la signature d'une convention cadre de partenariat avec le Pôle de compétitivité français «ViaMéca» pour élargir son assise technologique et mettre à la disposition des entreprises des compétences dans les différents domaines d'activité des IME.
ViaMéca est un pôle de compétitivité regroupant sur un même territoire (Rhône-Alpes, Auvergne, Limousin et une partie des régions Centre, Midi-Pyrénées, Languedoc-Roussillon), des grandes entreprises et des PME, des organismes de recherche publics et privés et des établissements de formation et a pour vocation de faire émerger des projets collaboratifs innovants dans la filière mécanique (depuis 2006, plus de 200 projets de R&D collaboratifs ont été labellisés par ViaMéca), et ce, en puisant dans un réseau de compétences hautement qualifiées regroupant plus que 2.500 chercheurs des domaines public et privé, et 400 ingénieurs et diplômés en masters de recherche par an.
Le pôle se positionne actuellement, en tant qu'acteur principal d'accompagnement de la mutation profonde de l'industrie mécatronique, visant le passage d'une position de fabricant de produits vers une logique de fournisseur de service durable, via un leadership scientifique et de nombreux projets R&D axés sur trois thèmes : «Procédés Avancés de fabrication», «Ingénierie de Surface» et «Systèmes intelligents & Robotique».
A travers ce nouveau partenariat, qui s'inscrit dans la mise en oeuvre de la stratégie industrielle à l'horizon 2016 et la valorisation du contenu technologique de l'industrie nationale autour des filières touchant à l'aéronautique, les systèmes embarqués, les implants médicaux utilisant les nouveaux matériaux ..., et ce, en facilitant l'accès aux entreprises industrielles tunisiennes aux réseaux internationaux, le Centre vise à faire bénéficier ces entreprises de nouveaux atouts pour le développement à l'international et l'amélioration de leurs performances.
A cet effet, il y a lieu de mentionner que l'objet spécifique de cette convention est de transférer les technologies françaises avancées en mécatronique et contrôle industriel auprès des entreprises tunisiennes et de développer une capacité conjointe «gagnant- gagnant » d'actions à haute valeur ajoutée technologique sur la région euro méditerranéenne et les régions limitrophes accessibles depuis la Tunisie.
Elle vise, en particulier, à réaliser des actions couvrant les domaines de formation, d'ingénierie et de conseil, de conception et de mise en oeuvre de grands projets de développement industriel, ainsi que des programmes de promotion de l'innovation au sein des entreprises industrielles.
Ainsi, et grâce à cette convention, le Cetime entend développer les activités du CRT de Sousse autour de la mécatronique à travers le transfert des technologies innovantes dans le domaine des procédés de fabrication, de l'ingénierie de surfaces, de la robotique, de l'aéronautique, de l'automobile et de l'efficacité énergétique, améliorer la qualité et la productivité au sein des IME à travers des actions structurantes en matière de gestion de la production et de l'encadrement technique , et moderniser encore plus «l'infrastructure - qualité» du Cetime pour servir au mieux le entreprises exportatrices.
Il revient de signaler, par ailleurs, que cette convention a été conclue en marge d'une visite officielle d'une délégation composée de hauts responsables et experts du ministère de l'Industrie et de la Technologie, du ministère de l'Enseignement scientifique et de la Recherche scientifique, de l'Eniso, de la SPCS et de la société Telnet et s'insère dans le cadre de l'exécution du plan d'actions pour la création du Centre des Ressources Technologiques (CRT) de Sousse.
Au cours des visites effectuées aux pôles technologiques ViaMéca et Minatec, la délégation tunisienne a traité, avec les responsables français de ces pôles, de nombreux sujets se rapportant notamment aux modalités pratiques de réalisation d'une salle blanche au CRT - Sousse à l'instar de celle qui existe au pôle Minatec, ainsi qu'à la co-diplômation, échange de professeurs et étudiants visiteurs, etc., avec l'Enise (Ecole Nationale d'Ingénieurs de Saint-Etienne), l'IFMA (Institut Français de Mécanique Avancée) , l'ENSIL (Ecole Nationale Supérieure d'Ingénieurs de Limoges, Cemagref (Institut de Recherches en Sciences et Technologies pour l'Environnement), à l'innovation technologique et aux moyens de renforcement des capacités de laboratoires du Cetime.

description.hltext_display: Turm von Pisa glänzt wieder
description.content:
Der berühmte Schiefe Turm von Pisa war "in einem entsetzlichen Zustand". Salz, Tauben und Touristen hatten ihn arg verschmutzt. Nun wurde er viele Jahre lang gereinigt - alle 24.424 Steinquader. Das hat ein paar Millionen Euro verschlungen - aber es kommen ja jedes Jahr auch Millionen Touristen, um ihn zu sehen.
1987 wurde das Ensemble aus Turm, Kathedrale, Baptisterium und Friedhof von der UNESCO zum Weltkulturerbe erklärt. (Archivbild von April 2006)
(Foto: picture-alliance/ dpa/dpaweb)
Ein eisiger Wind pfeift um den Schiefen Turm von Pisa. Hoch oben zieht Marco Berettini seinen Hut über die Ohren und sucht hinter einer mittelalterlichen Säule Schutz. Seit Jahren befreit Berettini das weltberühmte Bauwerk von Meersalz, Taubendreck und Touristenkritzeleien. Mit Lasergeräten, Meißeln und Spritzen arbeiteten zehn Restauratoren acht Jahre und drei Monate daran, den 56 Meter hohen Turm mit seinen 24.424 Steinquadern zu reinigen. Im Februar endlich soll das Gerüst - eine Spezialanfertigung wegen der Neigung des Turms - abgebaut werden.
"Man muss mit Leidenschaft bei der Sache sein, wenn man den Turm retten will, sonst könnte man nie bei Tagesanbruch aufstehen und den ganzen Tag in Schieflage verbringen", sagt der 41-jährige Berettini. Nur zwölf Kilometer von der Mittelmeerküste entfernt wird der steinerne Koloss oft von Stürmen heimgesucht. Und in den glühend heißen Sommern der Toskana bieten die breiten, offenen Bögen kaum Schatten. "Die Bedingungen sind extrem, und wir müssen oft bei hohen Temperaturen arbeiten", berichtet Berettini. "Aber den Job macht man aus Liebe."
Luftverschmutzung, Touristen und Tauben
Der charakteristische gelbliche Stein stammt aus den Steinbrüchen von San Giuliano, die von der Turmspitze aus in den grünen Hügeln hinter Pisa zu sehen sind. "Die Steine waren in einem entsetzlichen Zustand, vor allem wegen der Luftverschmutzung, aber auch Touristen und Tauben haben dazu beigetragen", sagt der Chefrestaurator Anton Sutter.
Während der Besetzung durch protestierende Studenten Ende November 2010.
(Foto: picture alliance / dpa)
"Die Säulen sind mit Kapitellen geschmückt: Blumen, schaurigen Fratzen, Phantasietieren", erklärt er. Viele seien durch das vom Wind hergetragene Meersalz sowie das Regenwasser, das sich an manchen Stellen aufgrund der Neigung des Turms sammele, beschädigt worden. Im Zuge der Arbeiten sei zudem das Beton aus früheren Restaurierungen entfernt worden. "Und wir haben die Steine vom Taubenkot, von Graffiti und Fingerabdrücken der Touristen gereinigt, die sich abstützen, um auf den gewundenen Treppen ihr Gleichgewicht zu halten."
Der Legende nach wurde der Turm 1173 begonnen. Eine Adelige aus Pisa hatte demnach der Stadt 60 Münzen vermacht für die Errichtung eines prächtigen Glockenturms. Nachdem drei Stockwerke fertig waren, kippte der Bau und sank auf einer Seite mit den Grundmauern ein. Obwohl sich seither zahllose Architekten und Ingenieure an seiner Stabilisierung versuchten, behielt der Turm einen Neigungswinkel von gut vier Grad bei. 1987 wurde er von der Weltkulturorganisation UNESCO zum Weltkulturerbe erklärt, 1990 allerdings für die Öffentlichkeit geschlossen - aus Angst, er könnte umstürzen.
Für die nächsten 200 Jahre sicher
"Der Turm stand kurz vor dem Kollaps", sagt Giuseppe Bentivoglio von der Organisation Opera Primaziale, die für die Instandhaltung des Monuments zuständig ist. "Aber wir schafften es, das Abkippen zu stoppen und ihn zu stabilisieren. Jetzt besteht mindestens für die nächsten 200 Jahre kein Risiko."
2001 wurde das Wahrzeichen der Öffentlichkeit wieder zugänglich gemacht. Seither ist der Turm geöffnet - auch während der noch andauernden Restaurierungsphase. Schließlich soll der Strom von bis zu einer Million Besuchern jährlich nicht abreißen - mit dem Erlös der Eintrittskarten wird die Instandhaltung teilweise finanziert.
Rund sieben Millionen Euro verschlangen die Arbeiten. Wegen der weltberühmten Schieflage und des instabilen Untergrundes musste ein spezielles Gerüst gebaut werden, das ein Team von Bergsteigern von Stockwerk zu Stockwerk nach oben verschob. Bald haben die Alpinisten ihren letzten Einsatz am Turm - um die Stangen abzubauen. Der 33-jährige Urlauber Chrisjo Kunnathettu aus Deutschland ist begeistert: "Es war bestimmt nicht einfach, aber der Turm ist ein Stück Geschichte. Es wäre eine Schande, ihn nicht zu erhalten."

description.hltext_display: Incidente al musical di Spider Man
description.author: redazione@tgcom.it (Redazione TGCOM
description.content:
Stuntman cade e fa volo di trenta metri
Il musical di Broadway "Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark" non è nato sotto una buona stella. Già all'anteprima è stata rinviata cinque volte per problemi tecnici. Nel frattempo gli attori-acrobati sono stati protagonisti di quattro incidenti. L'ultimo si è verificato il 20 dicembre. Una corda non ha retto e Christopher Tierney ha fatto un volo di 30 metri. Ed è finito in ospedale.
Mancavano pochi minuti alla fine dello spettacolo quando si è verificato l'incidente e lo show è stato subito interrotto. L'attore 31enne è il trapezista principale dello show ed esegue acrobazie per i ruoli di Spider-Man. Qualcosa, però, non ha funzionato. Una corda, infatti, si è spezzata e Tierney ha fatto un volo di quasi trenta metri finendo tra le prime fila degli spettatori. Le sue condizioni sarebbero stabili, anche se dall'ospedale non emergono altri particolari.
ll musical "Spider Man", tra i più costosi della storia di Broadway, è ricco di effetti speciali e di spettacolari salti effettuati dagli stuntmen che impersonano l'uomo ragno. Ma la produzione dello spettacolo è stata tormentata da incidenti e la prima ufficiale a Broadway è stata più volte rinviata in attesa di superare i problemi ancora non risolti.
A Christopher è arrivata la solidarietà dei suoi colleghi, in particolare quella di Natalie Mendoza. L'attrice, infatti, si è infortunata durante la "prima" del musical e su Twitter scrive: "Dobbiamo tutti pregare per lui".

Calhoun 37, St. Joseph 34
Strong team defense gave Calhoun the edge it needed to pick up a 37-34 win over St. Joseph on Friday, Dec. 10.
“This was a tough team, but we made the plays we needed to make to win the game,” Chew said. “We had some great defense today that they could not overcome offensively.”

The Sandies pulled together to throttle Mathis in a 50-20 victory on Friday, Dec. 10.
“Jayda Barton had a great day on defense for us. Michelle Wagner and Raven Jones had really good offensive games and Sage Sexton did well on the boards for us,” Chew said. “Great execution on the offensive and defensive ends of the floor.”

“At one point in the game, we were down 10 points in their gym and used our team defense to come back and take a six-point lead,” Chew said. “We missed too many easy shots today, but was really pleased with the effort our team showed today in a tough situation. We pulled and cheered each other all game long.”

description.hltext_display: Martin has proven to be Broncos’ battering ram
description.content:
Greg Kreller/IPT Boise State junior running back Doug Martin has rushed for 1,113 yards and has 323 yards receiving for the Broncos this season. By Dave Southorn dsouthorn@idahopress.com Idaho Press-Tribune | 0 comments
© 2010 Idaho Press-Tribune
LAS VEGAS — When Boise State coach Chris Petersen calls Doug Martin “a freak,” he means it in the nicest way possible.
The 5-foot-9, 212-pound running back and his thick build have caused him to obtain quite a few nicknames for his tough between the tackles running. Martin has rushed for 1,113 yards on 184 carries this season with 27 catches for 323 yards, his first solely devoted to playing running back.
“He’s strong, he’s fast, he’s thick — he’s ideal for a running back,” Petersen said of the Stockton, Calif., native who was one of those classic Boise State finds. “... When we were recruiting him, I was thinking, what am I missing here? His coach was saying, ‘he’s a freak,’ and that fits.”
Boise State senior offensive tackle Matt Slater called him a “muscle hamster,” a name for those of short stature who get bulked up at the gym. The nickname and his running style have made him a fan favorite. Martin appreciates one of those.
“It’s cool, it has its pros and cons though — I do not like ‘muscle hamster,’” Martin said.
Call him what you will, but Martin is a workhorse. After seeing part-time action on defense in 2008 and 2009, he came into 2010 with 153 career carries, but earned the starting nod in fall camp.
In the first half Nov. 26 at Nevada, Martin had 133 yards on 19 attempts, but just five times for 19 yards in the second half. Against Utah State in the regular season finale, he rushed only eight times for 23 yards. To unleash the freak, is something Petersen is excited to do.
“Doug has just one speed — it wouldn’t matter if we were going to play a bowl game or spring ball,” Petersen said. “That’s the beauty of, I guess, being able to coach Doug, but when he brings so much to the table, you’re kind of directing Doug.”
Senior Jeremy Avery provides a speedy aspect to the Broncos’ 1-2 punch, which has helped keep Martin fresh. Make no mistake about it, however — Utah and its No. 8 rush defense has been looking at the challenge Martin presents.
“I really think he’s the catalyst,” Utah coach Kyle Whittingham said. “He’s a really tough runner, and when you can consistently get yards on the ground, it sets up the play action pass, which is where they hurt you the most.”
As the Broncos’ leading rusher, and on pace for one of the top 10 seasons in school history, Martin has particularly enjoyed this season above any other.
“It brought me back to my high school days when I was always the feature back,” Martin said. “It’s been pretty nice. It’s the position I love to play.”
Allowing Martin to focus on offense, as opposed to practicing and having meetings on both sides of the ball, has proven to be hugely important.
“I’m glad we were able to leave him alone — we knew he’d be special somehow, someway, whether it was going to be on defense or offense,” Petersen said. “I think in Doug’s heart, he’s a running back. He would’ve done whatever we were to ask him, so I think it’s nice we were able to leave him there and let him go.”

event_or_fact.property: of the Stockton, Calif., native who was one of those classic Boise State finds

description.hltext_display: No shortage of motivation
description.content:
Charlie Litchfield/IPT Boise State running back Jeremy Avery is one of 16 seniors who will end their Bronco careers trying to get win No. 48 today against Utah in the Maaco Bowl Las Vegas. By Dave Southorn dsouthorn@idahopress.com Idaho Press-Tribune | 0 comments
© 2010 Idaho Press-Tribune
LAS VEGAS — From a possible shot at the national title, or at least a Rose Bowl berth, to a Dec. 22 game. Some might expect Boise State to be disappointed.
They’re not.
As far as the Broncos see it, it’s pretty simple — they’re playing a top 20 team in Utah in a vacation destination early in the bowl season. As far as consolation prizes go, that’s pretty good.
“I think we were really, really fortunate,” Boise State coach Chris Petersen said. “This is a great matchup.”
After Boise State’s 34-31 overtime loss Nov. 26 at Nevada, the team’s BCS bowl hopes were dashed, but the team still realized it had other main goals to achieve — after all, as a non-BCS conference member, it’s no given to expect a BCS berth, as they learned after a perfect 2008 when Utah was ranked ahead of them and went to the Sugar Bowl.
One of the Broncos’ main goals is to win a bowl game, which is still a definite possibility. So what is driving the Broncos?
“Finishing strong, not getting beat twice by Nevada,” senior nickel Winston Venable said.
Losing to Nevada, in the fashion it happened, could have been enough for a team to lose a lot of confidence, but Boise State bounced back with a 50-14 win against Utah State on Dec. 4.
“Part of (football) is regrouping, recharging and playing a good game,” Petersen said. “Fortunately, we got to play a game that next week and they did a nice job of responding.”
When Boise State lost the 2007 Hawaii Bowl to East Carolina, they were coming off a loss to Hawaii that ended the regular season, and the team said being able to get right back to work after their defeat in November was important.
“It made us realize we couldn’t put our heads down, and it helped to push that other game out of our minds,” receiver Titus Young said.
Seniors like Young and Venable have seen their fair amount of success in their time at Boise State — the loss was just the fourth Young had seen in his four seasons and the first in Venable’s two.
That successful crew is motivated to win, but so are the younger players that look up to them.
“Everyone’s come out trying to get better, which we’ve done throughout the season,” sophomore linebacker J.C. Percy said. “We have a great senior class, and they mean a lot to us, so we won’t let them go out with a loss.”
Those Broncos who will be returning in 2011 say that even though the season won’t begin for nine months after tonight’s game, a win will go a long way to pushing them through the offseason.
“Bowl games are huge, they certainly are stepping stones into the next season,” Boise State quarterback Kellen Moore said.
For Utah, the team will want to continue its NCAA-best nine-game bowl win streak.
“It’s important to our players, and something we’re proud of,” Utah coach Kyle Whittingham said.
Just an hour or two after Whittingham spoke, his Utes and the Broncos were put in the same room at the Hard Rock Cafe. A bit of pushing and shoving occurred, showing both teams have the competitive juices flowing.
“I think it puts a lot more emphasis, a little more tension on the game,” Venable said. “We were motivated to play Utah before (Sunday) night.”
More about Boise State Football

description.hltext_display: Collision course
description.content:
LAS VEGAS — The original BCS busters against the poster children for the non-BCS cause.
When No. 20 Utah and No. 10 Boise State face off today in the Maaco Bowl Las Vegas, it not only will be the best pairing of teams outside the five BCS bowls, but also a contest between two teams with closely related roads to prominence.
“We’ve kind of been on similar paths, both had a lot of success the last 10 years — I think there are a lot of similarities,” Boise State quarterback Kellen Moore said. “... We’ve come up well in big games, both of our offenses are very high scoring, good coaching, good fan bases, good scenery.”
The Utes’ Fiesta Bowl contest in 2005 against Pittsburgh marked the first time a team from outside the six automatic-qualifying conferences or Notre Dame played in a BCS bowl. Their 35-7 win showed they no doubt belonged.
Boise State’s 2007 legendary Fiesta Bowl win was the next to feature a non-BCS team. The Broncos won again in Glendale, Ariz. in January, while Utah routed Alabama in the 2009 Sugar Bowl. TCU will play in the Rose Bowl on Jan. 1, their second BCS bowl, but the Utes and Broncos are the only teams to have played in two thus far — and they’ve won all four games.
“It wasn’t just about making those games, but winning them,” Utah coach Kyle Whittingham said. “I think what’s been important is that both teams kept looking forward after making it to the BCS.”
Whittingham served as co-head coach with Urban Meyer in the Utes’ Fiesta Bowl matchup nearly six years ago, while Boise State coach Chris Petersen took the Broncos to their game against Oklahoma in his first season.
The two coaches are a combined 118-24.
“I think it starts at the top,” Utah defensive end Christian Cox said. “What I’ve known about coach Petersen and what coach Whittingham represents, they genuinely care about where they are and the guys they coach. I think the loyalty they have really attracts players — some they might not have been able to get a few years ago.”
Petersen is hardly one to take much credit, instead saying that it has more to do with the attitude of winning around a program than the man running it.
“I think you just have to look at the stability of the program, and I think coach Whit has plans to be there a long time,” Petersen said. “That does help, but I think the program and winning tradition is as big as anything.”
Both Petersen and Whittingham have seen overtures from so-called “bigger schools,” but have opted to continue to build their programs. With Utah’s move to the Pac-12 and Boise State’s to the Mountain West, both have overseen a considerable move toward the future.
“I’m not a grass is greener type of guy, and neither is Chris,” Whittingham said. “We like where we live, we like where our teams are headed, with what they’ve done and us going to the Pac-12. At a lot of schools outside the BCS, there’s not a lot of stability, but I know it’s here and at Boise State.”
Located in states not renowned for being pipelines of football talent, unlike a school like TCU, both have been able to spread out and recruit all over the country, plus found those “diamonds in the rough.”
Utah’s final team recruiting rankings the past two signing days, according to Rivals.com, have been 32nd and 44th nationally. In the seven before that, they did not crack the top 50. And we all know about Boise State.
“Their approach, not being in a BCS conference, they have that chip on their shoulder, is just like the one we have,” said Boise State receiver Austin Pettis, whose three offers out of high school were from Boise State, Utah and Utah State.
When Boise State announced it would join the Mountain West in June, it appeared the Utes would become the Broncos’ new conference rival, considering their proximity and the programs’ history of success. However, Utah’s move to the Pac-12 led the cancellation of the final three games (for 2011, 2012 and 2013) of a series that started in 2006 (a 36-3 Boise State win).
If the two similar programs can’t begin a rivalry in conference, then it puts even more of a special feeling into today’s game.
“We definitely would have liked to have them on the schedule, but it didn’t work out,” Petersen said. “Playing them in a bowl like this is a great opportunity. We have those similarities, which makes it even more interesting.”
More about Boise State Football

Danilo Amerio, Bobby Solo, Charlotte, Franco Fasano, Marco Ferradini, Riccardo Fogli, Silvia Mezzanotte e Andrea Mirò sono gli artisti di Vocinsieme che presentano a Tgcom il video "La notte più dolce che c'è". description.hltext_display: Så slår köldknäppen mot tekniken
description.content:
Dags för nästa köldknäpp. Och det innebär att elektronik, batterier och massor av annan teknik slås ut. Men nu vill Försvaret lära ut hur man skyddar prylarna mot köldskador.I slutet av januari ordnar Försvarsmaktens vinterenhet i Boden kursen ”Materielsystem i subarktiskt klimat”. Förutom tekniska officerare kommer anställda från Bolidens Aitikgruva i Gällivare att delta.
– Intresset har varit stort. Kunskapen om hur kyla påverkar teknik är dålig i samhället och tyvärr även inom försvaret, säger major Jonas Skär vid vinterenheten.
Redan när temperaturen kryper under noll börjar datorer, mobiltelefoner, hydraulik, motorer och bränslen påverkas.
Mest påtagligt är försämringen av batterier. Försök med elbilar i Danmark och Sverige visar att räckvidden nästan halveras och värmen i kupén inte räcker till.
Även vanliga bilbatterier tar stryk av kylan.
– De tappar avsevärt i spänning, säger Jonas Skär.
En test som redovisades tidigare i år i Göteborgs-Posten visade att svensk vinterkyla knäckte två av sex pekskärmsmobiler. Förutom batterierna blir skärmarna ”sega” när det fryser på.
Försvaret har särskilda krav på sina datorer men vid minus 20 börjar även de ta stryk.
För att känna sådana gränser och hur man ska skydda utrustningen krävs kunskap och erfarenhet från fält.
- Problemet är att vi får allt mer elektronik och ny teknik i vår utrustning, vilket gör att vi måste öka kompetensen kring hur de fungerar i kallt klimat, säger Jonas Skär.
Norrlandsbrigaderna, som lades ner år 2000 fungerade förr som en tuff testplats för Försvarets fordon, apparater och material. Här härdades till exempel den gamla slitvargen Bandvagn 202 och efterföljaren 206, två bandvagnar som tog sig fram genom myrar, blötmarker och nästan hur djup snö som helst.
– I dag testas ny utrustningen på olika ställen och under varierande förhållanden. Förutom att kompetensen blir spridd, innebär det att grejerna inte prövas under tuffast möjliga förhållanden, säger Jonas Skär.
”Materielsystem i subarktiskt klimat” genomförs i år för andra gången. Det är Luleå tekniska universitet som genomför kursen åt Försvarsmakten. Förutom praktiska övningar i Boden ingår en teoretisk del i Luleå.

description.hltext_display: Seadrift girls slam Cade 21-6
description.content:
Seadrift 7th 21, Cade 6
The Seadrift 7th-grade girls’ basketball team (3-1) slammed Cade in a 21-6 win on Monday.
“Madison Carter continues to lead the team in scoring and steals, and had scored in double figures in every game but one,” coach Kelly Lillge said. “We have a new addition to the team with Journi Huddler, who adds greater depth to our defense.”
In addition to Carter’s 13 points for the Lady Pirates, Tiffany Galloway had four points, while Christina Nguyen and Zoey Dierlam had two points apiece.
Dierlam led the team with 15 rebounds, while Galloway and Huddler had five each. Carter and Dierlam had 10 steals, followed by Galloway and Huddler with six apiece in the win.
Seadrift 8th 34, Cade 7
The Seadrift 8th-grade girls’ basketball team (4-0) throttled Cade for a 34-7 victory on Monday.
“There was never an doubt as to who controlled the game; we talked about setting the tempo from the tip and the girls did exactly that. Taylor Wilson scored in double figures with 22 and really dominated on the boards; Ashley Cunningham had a great defensive game as well,” coach Kelly Lillge said. “Madison Carter and Tiffany Galloway pulled double duty helping the 8th grade team because of so many out with the flu. Kassidy Colianni has been designated the spark plug for the team and leads the team in steals.”
Wilson had a team-high 22 points, while Ashley Cunningham had four points. Kassidy Colianni, Marissa Martinez, Madison Carter and Franny Youngblood had two points each.
Wilson had four rebounds, Youngblood had three and Martinez added two. Wilson also had 15 steals, followed by Cunningham and Colianni with nine and Martinez with six.
Travis 8th A 52,
Stroman 12
The Travis 8th-grade ‘A’ team (9-0) toppled Stroman in a 52-12 win on Monday afternoon.
McKenna Villegas led the team with 18 points, followed by Kaylee Escobaar, Moriah Guzman and Bryanna Delgado with six points apiece. Annie Hernandez had four and Jenna Boedeker added two.
Villegas had six rebounds and Escobar had four, followed by Boedeker and Hernandez with three apiece. Delgado had four steals, while Villegas, Boedeker and Ashley Wynn had two each.
Travis 8th B 39, Stroman 9
The Travis 8th-grade ‘B’ team (3-1) defeated Stroman Middle School, 39-9, on Monday.
Samantha Jackson finished with 10 points, followed by Samantha Woodward with eight and Macee Wunderlich with seven. Kristi Rothmann had four points for the Lady Fiddlers.
Woodward had nine rebounds, while Maribel Olachia had eight. Alondra Valadez, Kelsyi Meza and Allyssa Ortega had five rebounds apiece. Jackson led with 12 steals, followed by Valadez, Wunderlich, Olachia and Woodward with five steals each.
Travis 7th A 22,
Stroman 6
The Travis 7th-grade ‘A’ basketball team (9-0) continued its winning streak with a 22-6 win over Stroman Middle School on Tuesday.
“The girls had an off-night Monday, but still managed to pull off another win,” coach Donna Williams said. ”We had some good steals, but had numerous turnovers; we still need to work on it.”
Lexi Kurtz led with 12 points, followed by Miranda Moya with six points. Jackie Brumfield and Haley Herrera had two points each.
Kurtz had six rebounds for the Lady Fiddlers, while Savannah Cantu and Kelsey Tidrick had five apiece. Jessamy Tomlinson added four and Tishona White had three. Kurtz had five steals, while Moya added four. Herrera and White had three each in the victory.
Travis 7th B 29, Stroman 7
The Travis 7th-grade ‘B’ team (4-0) picked up its fourth win of the season with a 29-7 victory over Stroman on Monday.
“The girls are getting better everyday and are getting more confidence; I am proud of the way they are playing,” coach Tiffany Wenglar said. “We ran some things that we have not and did very well.”
Jessica Vega finished with 10 points, while Orianna Cantu added another eight. Sayler Navarro had five and Alejandra Villalon had three.
Navarro led with nine rebounds, followed by Katrina Escobar with eight and Villalon with four. Melissa Rodriguez and Robyn Stringo had three each. Vega’s 11 steals and Villalon’s nine were followed by Escobar with five and Navarro’s four steals in the game.

Melbourne Victory confirm Archie Thompson will miss up to five weeks with a hamstring injury, and Kevin Muscat says it's a significant setback.

After all the speculation in the lead up to the Ashes all the questions would now finally be answered.

description.hltext_display: Argentina le pone límites a las grasas trans en los alimentos
description.content:
Según el Ministerio de Salud, el consumo de grasas hidrogenadas aumenta los niveles de colesterol, incrementando el riesgo de enfermedades cardiovasculares.
El Gobierno de Argentina restringió el contenido de las grasas "trans" (hidrogenadas) en los alimentos para prevenir las enfermedades cardiovasculares.
De acuerdo con una resolución adoptada por los Ministerios de Salud y de Agricultura, el contenido de ácidos grasos "trans" no debe ser mayor a 2 por ciento del total de grasas en aceites vegetales y margarinas destinadas al consumo directo y a 5 por cieno del total de grasas en el resto de los alimentos.
Según explicó el Ministerio de Salud en un comunicado, el consumo de grasas "trans" aumenta el colesterol "malo" (LDL) y disminuye el colesterol "bueno" (HDL) en la sangre, incrementando el riesgo de enfermedades cardiovasculares, las que representan el 32 por ciento de las causas de muerte en Argentina.
La norma prevé un plazo de adecuación de 2 años para los aceites vegetales y las margarinas y de hasta 4 años para los demás alimentos.
Desde hace algunos años, varias empresas del sector de alimentos vienen sustituyendo las grasas "trans" en muchos de sus productos.
"Esta modificación del Código Alimentario Argentino permitirá que este proceso se acelere y que las empresas que aun no lo han hecho introduzcan estos cambios en forma obligatoria dentro de un plazo que le permita realizar las modificaciones tecnológicas en la elaboración de sus productos", señaló el comunicado del Ministerio de Salud.

description.hltext_display: Freshman girls pick up first win
description.content:
The Calhoun freshman girls’ basketball team picked up its first win of the season during the Corpus Christi freshman tournament last weekend.
Calhoun freshman 12, Calallen 11
After trailing 7-1 at halftime, the Sandies came back to win the game in the last 44 seconds of play thanks to a Kyrstin Downs free throw and basket by Zoe Ramirez for the win.
“How many times do you have one point at half and win the game,” coach Rick Spencer said. “That was a first for me.”

description.hltext_display: PM’s overseas trips cost RM8.7 million: Nazri
description.author: Hemananthani Sivanandam
description.content:
newsdesk@thesundaily.com
KUALA LUMPUR (Dec 22, 2010): The Prime Minister’s Office has spent about RM8.72 million on the premier’s foreign trips overseas since he took office in April last year.
In a written reply, Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department Datuk Seri Nazri Aziz said that the total cost for Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Abdul Razak and his office were RM8,724,895.91.
He said this in reply to PKR Senator Dr Syed Husin Ali who had asked to list the countries visited by the prime minister since he assumed office and the expenditure for each trip.
In a press conference in Parliament lobby today, Syed Husin said the number of days Najib spent overseas were 274 days.
"What caught my attention here is the number of days (that Najib has been the PM) is 588 days (from April 3, 2009 to Nov 19, 2010).
"The number of days that he spent overseas was 274 days. So the thing is, he spent almost half of his time overseas when there are so many problems in the country that need to be looked into," said Syed Husin.
Syed Husin also questioned if the "real profit" gained from these overseas trips and its returns to the country.
The written reply showed that Najib had gone on 42 official trips to various countries. Among the most expensive trips were visits to Vietnam, the US and Japan. The trips, taken April 5-22 this year, cost RM2,094,635.39.
The other trip was again to the US from Sept 20 to Oct 8, which cost RM1,043,923.85.
Meanwhile Syed Husin also revealed that the three-day First Ladies Summit held in October incurred expenses of RM4,498,949.99.
In a written reply, the Women, Family and Community Development Ministry said that the summit had brought many benefits to the country as it was a successful platform for first ladies to share their experiences and best practices in leadership, development of children, establishing and strengthening the multilateral relations of the first ladies.
The summit, which was held Oct 11-13, was participated by 28 countries, 14 first ladies, 20 ministers and 200 delegates participating in the event.

description.hltext_display: European shares edge up; ARM soars
description.content:
Share on LinkedIn
Share on Facebook
Related News
Tue, Dec 21 2010
Mon, Dec 20 2010
Wed, Dec 15 2010
Thu, Dec 9 2010
Related Topics
Stocks
LONDON | Wed Dec 22, 2010 3:22am EST
LONDON Dec 22 (Reuters) - European shares edged up in early trade on Wednesday, having hit a 27-month high in the previous session, and with Microsoft supplier, ARM (ARM.L), higher after media reports that Microsoft plans new windows for tablets.
At 0821 GMT, the FTSEurofirst 300 .FTEU3 index of top European shares was up 0.1 percent at 1,146.83 points, after rising 1.1 percent in the previous session to its highest close since September, 2008.
"Investors will be happy to see the market close off the year with a decent gain," said Richard Jeffrey chief investment officer at Cazenove Capital Management. "There's a lot of macro information today that may influence people's thinking on 2011."
Chip designer ARM rose more than 8 percent on reports Microsoft MSOFT.O is planning new windows for tablets.
Later, investors' attention will turn to U.S. economic data, such as home sales and GDP growth. (Reporting by Brian Gorman)

description.content:

Calhoun 37, St. Joseph 34
Strong team defense gave Calhoun the edge it needed to pick up a 37-34 win over St. Joseph on Friday, Dec. 10.
“This was a tough team, but we made the plays we needed to make to win the game,” Chew said. “We had some great defense today that they could not overcome offensively.”

Calhoun 50, Mathis 20
The Sandies pulled together to throttle Mathis in a 50-20 victory on Friday, Dec. 10.
“Jayda Barton had a great day on defense for us. Michelle Wagner and Raven Jones had really good offensive games and Sage Sexton did well on the boards for us,” Chew said. “Great execution on the offensive and defensive ends of the floor.”

The Sandies dropped a close 43-41 loss to Goliad to close out tournament play on Saturday, Dec. 11.
“At one point in the game, we were down 10 points in their gym and used our team defense to come back and take a six-point lead,” Chew said. “We missed too many easy shots today, but was really pleased with the effort our team showed today in a tough situation. We pulled and cheered each other all game long.”

Jayda Barton 7, Rilea Whitaker 7, Summer Wunderlich 7, Sage Sexton 6, Brayson McGrew 6, Kendall Smith 5, Amanda Villarreal 3.

Raven Jones and Jayda Barton were named to the all-tournament team for the Goliad tournament.

description.hltext_display: Rossi piange Bearzot: Per tutti sono Pablitoma lo devo solo a lui
description.content:
Rossi piange Bearzot: “Per tutti sono Pablitoma lo devo solo a lui”
Il dolore sincero di Paolo Rossi per la scomparsa dell’ex commissario tecnico azzurro: “E’ stato il più grande di tutti, un italiano semplice, forte, popolare e amato da chiunque”
Quel naso triste come una salita, quegli occhi allegri da italiano in gita. Paolo Conte lo scrisse di Bartali, e sarebbe stato perfetto anche per Enzo Bearzot. “Un italiano semplice, forte, schietto e popolare, amato da tutti, un grande italiano del '900”, è il tributo del suo uomo Mundial, Paolo Rossi. Senza il ‘Vecio’, non ci sarebbe mai stato Pablito. Lo dice la storia del calcio italiano, con quella scelta coraggiosa del ct di convocare Rossi in Spagna e di insistere su di lui al Mondiale. Lo ricorda l'uomo dei tre gol al Brasile, senza riuscire a trattenere le lacrime per la morte del ct campione del mondo. “Se sono diventato quel che sono, lo devo a lui: per me è stato un padre, ma per tutti è un grande italiano del '900. Nel calcio, il più grande”, ricorda l'ex azzurro. Rossi trattiene a stento l'emozione.
“Davvero, non ci riesco”, dice, interrompendo con un singhiozzo il flusso di ricordi e dolore. “È stato il più grande di tutti - riprende - perché aveva dei valori umani fortissimi. I suoi legami non si sonomai spezzati, con tutti i suoi ragazzi. Ma io per lui ero come un figlio, e lui per me come un padre. La sua, la nostra, è stata una storia straordinaria. Vorrei dire di un altro calcio, quando c'era passione ed amore”.
Tutti i tifosi italiani ricordano la chiamata dell'attaccante della Juve dopo sole tre partite di campionato, la squalifica del caso scommesse appena terminata; e ancor di più quel tris di sfide mondiali nel girone senza lo straccio di un guizzo, e gol personali neanche a parlarne. Bearzot con il numero 20 azzurro andò avanti per la sua strada, come sempre gli capitava. Dal Brasile in poi ebbe ragione. E nacque il mito di Pablito. “Me lo diceva sempre, stai sereno, tranquillo che il gol arriva - ricorda oggi Rossi - E poi, contrariamente all'immagine di un ct vecchio stampo, tutto difesa e contropiede, Bearzot aveva uno spessore tecnico enorme: conosceva a memoria ogni avversario, lo studiava ed era molto meticoloso. Così prima di ogni partita mi prendeva a parte, mi spiegava chi avevo di fronte, come attaccare la difesa, e in quale zona di campo giocare”. Una lezione tecnica e soprattutto di vita. “Con lui non davi il 100%, ma il 200 - continua Pablito - Sono sicuro, ci avrà pensato mille e mille volte prima di chiamarmi per la Spagna e ogni volta che mi doveva riconfermare in campo: ma io da lui ho sempre e solo avvertito grande fiducia, calore ed affetto”. Razza friulana, ricorda Rossi: “ Aveva un carattere anche rude, e nello spogliatoio sapeva essere duro. Ma era una rudezza sana, schietta. Ecco, onestà e schiettezza sono le due doti che tutti devono ricordare. Il nostro rapporto di fiducia nacque già nel '78, Cabrini ed io eravamo i volti nuovi di quella bellissima Italia. E nei due anni prima dell'82, quando ero fermo, mi telefonava spesso”.
“Poi, quattro anni dopo il trionfo di Spagna - aggiunge rivelando un piccolo retroscena -, una volta mi chiamò: 'Paolo, guarda che io ti porto in Messico in ogni caso, ma se continui a star così giù, mi sa che facciamo del male prima di tutto a te stessò. Ecco, questo era Bearzot: schietto, nel bene e nel male’. Così il legame è rimasto, ha attraversato anni e vecchiaia. “L'ho visto l'ultima volta un anno fa, ad Auronzo dove passava sempre le vacanze - ricorda ancora commosso Rossi - La malattia l'aveva segnato fin troppo, era più schivo del solito. Però che cultura, che voglia di parlare di tutto. Un uomo così non esiste più: perché non era uno scienziato né un artista, ma è stato l'italiano semplice e popolare, amato da tutti. Uno dei nostri grandi del '900”. Una storia a suo modo semplice e straordinaria.
LA CARRIERA DI BEARZOT
Mente del trionfo di Spagna ‘82, per 104 volte ct
Friulano di nascita, Enzo Bearzot, oppure il Vecio, il come era stato soprannominato, si è spento all’età di 83 anni. La sua è stata una vita dedicata al calcio: nato come mediano inizia la sua carriera da calciatore nella squadra del suo paese, Aiello del Friuli, ma qualcuno si accorge presto delle sue qualità e nel 1946 viene ingaggiato dalla Pro Gorizia, in serie B. Della sua carriera da calciatore si ricordano anche un’esperienza all’Inter, tre anni nel Catania e soprattutto le 164 presenze col Torino con cui costruisce la sua carriera. Una sola la presenza da giocatore con la maglia della nazionale. Appesi gli scarpini al chiodo, inizia la carriera da allenatore prendendo in mano la guida delle giovanili del Torino prima di diventare assistente di Nereo Rocco ed Edmondo Fabbri.
Dopo l’esperienza al Prato, arriva finalmente il primo impatto con la nazionale: nel 1969 viene ingaggiato come commissario tecnico dell’Under 23 che guiderà fino al 1975 prima del passaggio alla guida della nazionale maggiore con cui entrerà nella storia. Nel 1978 conquista il quarto posto nel Mondiale in Argentina, in cui nella prima fase riesce a battere anche i padroni di casa che si aggiudicheranno poi il trofeo. Ma la vera impresa arriva quattro anni dopo in Spagna dove l’Italia si laureò campione del mondo per la terza volta nella sua storia. Un traguardo memorabile, conquistato superando squadre come Argentina e Brasile, prima della Germania in finale, e soprattutto contro le feroci critiche della stampa italiana contro cui Bearzot inventò l’ormai famoso silenzio stampa. Poco felice il prosieguo della sua avventura da ct azzurro: nel 1986 in Messico l’Italia uscirà agli ottavi, eliminata dalla Francia, e Bearzot si dimetterà dopo 104 partite in panchina, record che tutt’ora resta imbattuto.
Prandelli: “Perso un grande maestro”
"Il calcio italiano perde il protagonista di una delle pagine più belle ed emozionanti della sua storia,ma soprattutto perde un maestro di calcio che della gestione del gruppo ha fatto una filosofia alla quale tutta la scuola di allenatori italiani continua a fare riferimento". Così il commissario tecnico azzurro Cesare Prandelli ricorda Enzo Bearzot.
"Il formidabile successo del Mondiale in Spagna nell'82 è stata la logica conseguenza di un altro capolavoro, il quarto posto conquistato nell'edizione precedente, quella del '78 in Argentina, con una Nazionale ricostruita dalle fondamenta sotto il profilo tecnico e soprattutto attitudinale - ha proseguito Prandelli -. Il coraggio delle sue scelte, delle quali hanno beneficiato giovani talenti del calibro di Cabrini, Rossi, Bergomi - solo per citarne alcuni - ai quali Bearzot dispensava consigli e fiducia, ci ha consegnato una generazione di campioni quasi senza eguali. Ci mancherà e mancheranno al calcio la sua saggezza, l'onesta e il buon senso".
//La Voce d´Italia
La Voce d´Italia C.A. @ 2004 Tutti i diritti riservati.

description.hltext_display: Knee injury sidelines Antonis for a month
description.content:
Sydney FC youngster Terry Antonis will be sidelined for the next month with a knee injury.
The highly-rated 17-year-old, who has played five games this A-League season for the Sky Blues, sustained the injury during last Friday's National Youth League match against Adelaide United at Hindmarsh Stadium.
Scans have confirmed the attacking midfielder suffered cartilage damage to his right knee and he'll now undergo a rehabilitation program.
"It is disappointing for me because I love playing," Antonis said.
"I have learnt a lot this season and I guess this is another part of football. I will be patient and do what the staff say and work back into it."
AAP

Reports suggest that Inter Milan sack boss Rafael Benitez after six months.

North Queensland Fury Chief Executive Officer Rabieh Krayem discusses the future of his club.
Queen Elizabeth II's grand daughter Zara Phillips is engaged to England rugby star Mike Tindall.
Rugby league personality Matthew Johns says he is lucky to be alive after he and several Gold Coast Titans players collapsed on a boat in Queensland because of an exhaust leak.
Ricky Ponting is facing a fitness dilemma for the fourth Ashes Test starting in Melbourne on Boxing Day.
After all the speculation in the lead up to the Ashes all the questions would now finally be answered.
European Golf rookie of the year Matteo Manassero targets a place in the world's top-50 and the Ryder Cup squad.
Austria's Marlies Schild has won her second world cup slalom of the season after two of her major rivals crashed out of the event in France.
